result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Earl Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Earl Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert N. Meyeroff in court for Steven Earl Johnson.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a bail/bon hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a projected plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Branch 11 is in trial. Court moves bail bond hearing to 10/04/2022 at 3:00pm. State is not available at the given time. Bail Bond hearing will be heard at the status conference date scheduled on October 6, 2022 at 1:30pm. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Bail/bond hearing on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Earl Johnson in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Defendant Steven Earl Johnson in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested adjournment due to waiting to hear back from fingerprint expert.  State does not object.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 12 pages) commencing 03-21-2022 by ROBYN D. HARRELL.
Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Earl Johnson in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Steven Earl Johnson in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also present, Attorney Robert Meyeroff.  All parties appear in person.
Attorney Meyeroff advises he's been retained.
Court grants substitution of counsel.
Attorney Harris has turned over discovery.
Attorney Meyeroff may be hiring an expert.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Clerk:  jms
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (12 pages) commencing March 21, 2022 by Robyn D. Harrell.
Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Steven Earl Johnson not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court that he has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests adjournment to review it with the defendant.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Steven Earl Johnson in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Steven Earl Johnson in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Schlachter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Earl Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUES for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:

Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Walgreens, 2625 W. National Avenue, Milwaukee; C.A.W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Steven Earl Johnson in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Steven Earl Johnson in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven Earl Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
